title: Girl, 17, digitally raped her five-year-old step-niece
title_page: Girl, 17, digitally raped her five-year-old step-niece | Daily Mail Online
text:
A 17-year-old girl who digitally penetrated a five-year-old has been ordered to undergo a psychological program for young sexual offenders.
The girl who cannot be named faced the Children's Court at Maroochydore after raping the child between August 1 and December 31, 2014 when she was aged between 14 and 15, according to the Sunshine Coast Daily.
The teenager was also placed on probation for the offence on her step-niece which occurred one morning in the child's father's house.
A 17-year-old girl who digitally penetrated a five-year-old has been ordered to undergo a a psychological program for young sexual offenders (stock image)
Legal aid lawyer Mark Dixon who represented the teenager, said his client was sexually and physically abused from 12 to 16 years old and was now suffering from depression and anxiety.
He also said that she had also been homeless for the last 18 months to two years after losing contact with her parents.
The little girl has since become emotional, according to Crown prosecutor Alex Stark.
The teenage girl was sentenced to two years probation and ordered to attend the Griffith Youth Forensic Service which provides specialist assessment and treatment services to youth in relation to sexual offence
Judge Garry Long also did not record a conviction.
